Administration.text:
Type:
Antifungal
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: Oral, topical
Common Trade Names: Lamisil

Adult_Dosing.text:
250-500mg PO 1-2 times per day
Apply topically 1-2 times per day

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
>12yo, topical: apply 1-2 times per day
>4yo, oral
<25kg: 125mg PO daily
25-35kg: 187.5mg PO daily
>25kg: 250mg PO daily

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: contraindicated in hepatic impairment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Chronic or active liver disease

Serious.text:
SJS/TEN
Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis
Systemic or cutaneous lupus
Neutropenia
Liver failure
Hearing loss

Common.text:
Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, indigestion
Rash
Elevated LFTs
Headache
Cough, fever, URI symptoms

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 22-26h
Metabolism: Hepatic CYP2C9, CYP1A2, CYP3A4, CYP2C8 and CYP2C19
Excretion: Mostly renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Inhibits ergosterol in fungal cell membrane
